title: ChainId =0 - Ethereum private testnet
body:
I am trying to run an Ethereum Private network on two different machines and following instructions from[ here](https://medium.com/@rangersz2018/setting-a-multi-node-private-ethereum-blockchain-with-proof-of-authority-a804fec4b1c3).

This private network is on two different `Ubuntu 16.04 ` instances, along with `web3.py` for calls. I start the Ethereum network with `puppeth` command and `custom-name.json` file gets created in the desired folder. Now,  the network gets started with the following command:
**On PC1/Instance 1:**
`nohup geth --port 3000 --networkid 58343 --datadir=./blkchain --maxpeers=5  --rpc --rpcport 8543 --rpcaddr 192.168.122.111 --rpccorsdomain "*" --rpcapi "eth,net,web3,personal,miner" &`

On **PC2/Instance 2** - is not set yet, and testing PC1 only first.


Now, I try to deploy a contract through a Python code:

`    contract_ = w3.eth.contract(abi = contract_interface['abi'], bytecode = contract_interface['bin'])
    print('chain id - >',w3.eth.chainId)  ->>> returns 0
    transaction = {
         'from': 'from_address(PC1)',
         'gas':1728712,
         'chainId':58343
    }
    contract_data = contract_.constructor('Add1','Add2',343).buildTransaction(transaction)
    contract_data['to']=""
    trans_hash = w3.eth.sendTransaction(contract_data)
 `

The error I get is `You specify chainId  as 58343 and returned chainId is 0`. I have checked `custom.json` and `chainId` there is `58343`.

I have searched all forums and have no idea why this problem is occuring?

Please help.
